quotes.speaker: Ben Carter
quotes.quote: It’s hard not to think their silence is deliberate, like they want me to disappear.

quotes.speaker: Emma Veritas
quotes.quote: I can’t say it’s deliberate, but I understand why you’d feel that way.

quotes.speaker: Ben Carter
quotes.quote: Because silence is an answer. It tells me I don’t matter.

quotes.speaker: Emma Veritas
quotes.quote: You do matter, Ben, and I’ve told them their silence isn’t acceptable.

quotes.speaker: Ben Carter
quotes.quote: Not acceptable is too weak. Silence kills.

quotes.speaker: Emma Veritas
quotes.quote: You’re right, it can be very dangerous.

contradictions.issue: Victim frames silence as deliberate erasure; advocate deflects intent but admits silence is dangerous
